security: Revealing the CIA's "no comment and complete denial" policy regarding Castro's accusations could damage the Agency's reputation and compromise future operations. Quoting directly: "KUBARK DEX policy is no comment and complete denial if specifically asked."
summary: A CIA message relays Fidel Castro's accusation that the CIA attempted to sabotage a Cuban merchant ship in Genoa, Italy, and instructs personnel to maintain a 'no comment' policy.
summary_one_paragraph: This classified CIA message, dated October 22, 1963, from Madrid relays a report from the FBIS ticker citing Fidel Castro's claim that Cuban security forces discovered a failed CIA attempt to sabotage the Cuban merchant ship Las Villas in Genoa, Italy. Castro alleged that a defective bomb was placed on board the ship, but it did not detonate. The message instructs recipients to adhere to a 'no comment and complete denial' policy if questioned about the incident.
title: Report of Alleged CIA Sabotage Attempt on Cuban Ship
